wikipedia_page.main: Jonathan Scarth (18 February 1772 – 14 December 1850) was a partner in one of Manchester's early steam powered cotton mills in the late 18th century, and was an entrepreneur of the English Industrial Revolution.

response: Robert Moorsom died peacefully in 1835 as a full Admiral of the Blue22 July 1830 and a Knight Commander of the Order of the Bath2 January 1815 and was buried at St Peter's Church, Cosgrove, Northamptonshire,Memorial plaque: St Peter’s Church where a memorial plaque to him and his wife Eleanor (sister of cotton milling entrepreneur Jonathan Scarth) can still be seen. Robert's legacy included his talent for poetry and drawing which he passed on to his two sons, Vice Admiral Constantine Richard Moorsom 1792-1861 and Captain William Scarth Moorsom, an early railway engineer.Jehanne Wake, Kleinwort, Benson: the history of two families in banking, p.89, accessed 18 November 2008 A descendant (via Constantine) is the English journalist Toby Young and Canadian journalist Richard Moorsom Harrison.
